sub_title: Relocation Consultant | Global Mobility Practioner | Facilitator | Omek Student Circle Lead | MIM+ Graduate
summary:
A Relocation Specialist with a strong interest in Global Mobility 

Successfully coordinated the transition of over 100 transferees, ensuring seamless integration into their new environments. This involved coordination of temporary living arrangements, travel, and home-finding services.

In Belgium and the Netherlands, I lead our team's efforts to achieve ISO and EURA EQGS certifications. These attestations underline our commitment to excellence, quality management, adherence to stringent global standards and compliance.

Took charge of a comprehensive feedback review initiative. By methodically analyzing client feedback, I derived actionable insights that have played a crucial role in enhancing client experiences and overall satisfaction.

Beyond mere transactional interactions, I have cultivated and maintained strong client relationships, ensuring their needs are consistently met and their expectations. Every client interaction is viewed as an opportunity to deepen trust, understanding, and long-term partnership.

certifications.name: MIM+ Collaborating in the Next Normal
Safeguarding Young People for International Schools

profile_positions.description:
In the realm of professional relocation, I've distinguished myself as an adept relocation strategist. My attention to detail, coupled with the foresight to preempt potential challenges, ensures my clients transition with ease, irrespective of the complexities associated with work-related relocations.

Whether you're a seasoned international professional or embarking on your first expatriate adventure, I am positioned to be your essential ally throughout the journey. My proficiency extends to aiding both individuals and organizations in navigating the intricate relocation processes within the EU and internationally. My personal experience as an expat provides me with an intimate understanding of the unique challenges and vast opportunities that come with transitioning to a new locale..

Relocating—whether individually or within a corporate framework—requires more than just knowledge. It demands specific expertise, an unwavering focus on service excellence, and a commitment to the finer details. And that's precisely what I bring to the table.

Key Projects & Achievements:

- Designed, managed, and analyzed comprehensive evaluations from clients to enhance service delivery.
- Spearheaded the project management for ISO 9001 & EGQS certifications in both the Netherlands and Belgium.
- Successfully implemented a harmonized 'Active Cases' sheet, ensuring consistent tracking and management across consultants.
- Devised and executed a dynamic client database, enhancing client relationship management and efficiency.
- Overseeing my team's compliance with established client data protocols to ensure consistent and accurate data collection.
profile_positions.title: Relocation Consultant

profile_positions.description:
In this role I helped consultants with backend assistance.
Engaging with our service partners and realtors.
Improved internal mechanisms for communicating with field consultants.
profile_positions.title: Relocation Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Omek is a community-centric platform dedicated to the social and professional advancement of African diaspora talent.  We offer an integrated experience through a combination of digital and physical spaces, and connect with partners — providing resources and support systems.

As Student Program Director I

- Manage communication with students and student-led associations
- Moderate student discussions during Omek events
- Engage with student networks in Europe and soon worldwide.
- Engage in the creation of events to facilitate collaboration and growth between Afro student networks
- Develop the Omek Student program to empower Bicultural students in the African Diaspora
profile_positions.title: Student Program Lead

profile_positions.description:
I plan and manage the facilitation of weekly, live, online, intercultural dialogue either as a solo facilitator or through co-facilitation.

As a facilitator I work with small groups of college students from various backgrounds such as Europe, America, Asia and the MENA region. The focus is on not only social and cultural issues but also current political themes all done through online video dialogue.
Additionally, I am responsible for the creation of weekly session plans, specific to the different groups at as there may be different areas of growth to focus on. As I direct the dialogue to stay on track and within the topic of discussion and ensure all voices are heard there may be issues of conflict that arise. It is within this role that I have increased my ability to resolve conflict and bridge differences in the process. 

If you have read this far, and I know this is not very LinkedIny, I have stolen this next quote from another facilitator and I think it is always nice to repeat it, "when we reject the single story, when we realize that there is never a single story about any place, we regain a kind of paradise," - Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie. With Soliya, I have truly found that all voices and stories are heard and it is truly beautiful to see in depth discussion of critical and conflictual issues being discussed respectfully, with open minds, hearts, personal stories and critical thinking.
profile_positions.title: Senior Cross Cultural Facilitator

profile_positions.description:
- Support facilitation and quality control management for First-Year Connect
- Assist with coordination of the summer dialogue program
- Work on projects to manage data sets
- Assist with community engagement
- Complete administrative tasks
- Co-facilitate 4 (1YC) groups
- Coach 1 (1YC) Groups
profile_positions.title: Quality Control Intern

profile_positions.description:
I helped educate visitors, school counselors and prospective international students about campus life, the history of Groningen, various traditions and Achievements (one of RUGs is that Aletta Jacobs was the first woman to officially attend a Dutch University). 

I did this by personally meeting with international students and school counselors by discussing life in Groningen and conducting campus tours and answering any questions that they had.

I mainly supported the International Office and their events but sometimes participated in other department events (Including, but not limited to: Welcome Days, Information counter, Open days, Airport Pick up, Start of year Festival and Chess Festivals)
profile_positions.title: Student Ambassador

profile_positions.description:
I worked closely with the board members of the ASC in order to allocate the yearly budget and maintain a record of expenditures and revenues throughout the year. Additionally, I participated in fundraising ventures to acquire more capital for the ASC in order to provide high quality events.   

In this position I oversaw the sale of tickets to paid events created by the ASC.

Started a new bank account for the ASC as the former had been made redundant. Ensured compliance with the Chamber of Commerce (KVK) by registering and deregistering the main members of the ASC as needed.
profile_positions.title: Treasurer

profile_positions.description:
I ensured proper and effective communication between the ASC, its members and the wider community. 

I did this by executing through marketing the ASC on various social media platforms, through outreach and messaging activities all regarding the events that are of interest to students, professors and the community. I ensured that the methods and events produced were sound by receiving feedback on ideas and needs of the members and the Groningen community. Additionally, I was present at every welcoming ceremony to speak to new students and get them to sign up to our community so they could either learn more about Africa or, as Africans, welcome them to the Netherlands and provide a space for them to feel at home.

I was responsible for maintaining the ASC webpage of the University of Groningen, various social media accounts and the bulletin boards of the University.

Additional Perk of this position is that I was the main photographer for the ASC. I was present at all events taking pictures. I then compiled the photos and videos from events to post them on Social Media.
profile_positions.title: Public Relations Coordinator - African Students Community Groningen

profile_positions.description:
In this role I improved the lives of our members by helping create opportunities for socialisation and exercise. I managed the planning and preparation of all events and extra-curricular activities hosted by the ASC. 

I met weekly with the Chairman of the ASC to discuss venue selection, date setting and budget allocation for these events. 

I was able to produce Two social events per month for our members during my time and helped organise weekly football training, matches and tournaments.
profile_positions.title: Social Coordinator

profile_positions.description: As a library assistant I helped organise the books in the library as they were revamping. Putting books into the system. I also aided young children choose books and helped them during reading time. Additionally, during my time in Phuket as a library assistant I also had the opportunity to teach athletics in the school.
profile_positions.title: Library Assistant

profile_positions.description:
As a teacher aide at Maru-a-Pula, I spent most of my time working in the Library. I had the tasks of coding, classifying, and cataloging books, publications, audiovisual aids, based on subject matter or standard library classification systems.

I helped to reorganise the library for easy by organizing collections of books, publications, documents, audiovisual aids, and other reference materials for convenient access. By doing this we were able to evaluate the status of many of the books and took the opportunity to determine outdated or unused items to be removed from circulation.
profile_positions.title: Teacher Aide

profile_positions.description:
Transcribed 16 hours of audio to text.
Topics included: teaching experience, new teachers, retired teachers.
profile_positions.title: PhD Assistant

company.name: United World Colleges - Botswana National Committee

Introducing new students to what Groningen can be like as a student; through cultural and sports-related activities.
